utterance.speaker: ABBY SMITH
utterance.content: Hey. I need to be at the club by 11, so I can’t really talk. Uh, skip it. But everyone who’s anyone is going to be there. I know. Look, I’ve really got to go. But I’ll be thinking about you. I’ll take a pic and send it to you to prove it.

utterance.speaker: ABBY
utterance.content: Hello? Is someone there?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Excellent. Now, mmm.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Vibrate. Vibrate, vibrate, vibrate!

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Now, breathe in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think – I think that’s – my vocal chords are about as warmed up as they’re going to get. Thank you so much. I thought you said you were just coming to watch, anyway.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, that was the plan. But then I discovered my expertise was needed. And don’t miss his forehead, honey. It’s shiny. What about this jacket, dear? Did you choose –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, I’m good. I’m – you know, I picked it out myself.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Because -

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you. You know, I’ve done this before, Mother. I know exactly what I’m doing. Thank you. You want to put just one more? Layers. Stack them right up on top of there. I think it’ll be great.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: There’s a boy over there filming you with his phone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s just behind the scenes stuff.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. It’s all part of the campaign. Just tapping into that whole 360 degree digital media environment.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah hah. Okay.

utterance.speaker: MO
utterance.content: Okay, Mr. Castle. We’re ready.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Excellent. Want to go sit with Mo?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh! Mo!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: CAMERAMAN
utterance.content: We’re rolling.

utterance.speaker: MO
utterance.content: And, action!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hi. I’m Richard Castle. Are you looking for a bone-chilling, spine-tingling thriller full of twists and turns? If you are, look no further than my latest novel, Raging Heat. Why don’t you download your copy today, because whether you get it on the download, buy a hard copy, or just listen to the audio version, I promise you, it’ll keep you hooked until the very last word.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oops.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: That must have been kind of embarrassing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It was a minor blow to my ego. After that I had to channel my inner Castle, but once I did … nailed it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wow. You nailed playing yourself. That’s impressive.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mock if you will, but pretty soon you’re going to see my image splashed across multiple platforms. It’s going to be Castle 2.0. It’s going to be Castle in the cloud.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute. Multiple platforms? I thought that this was a TV commercial.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Better. It’s a web-mercial. And once it drops in a few days, my publisher assures me that both Raging Heat and I will go viral. It’s time I let technology wrap me in its warm, lucrative embrace.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Huh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Gentlemen. Is there an elevator? Is this a walk-up? Hope it’s an elevator.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Victim’s name is Abby Smith. She’s 23 years old. A maintenance worker found her early this morning. We’re dealing with something messed up here.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: You got that right, starting off with these stab wounds.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They’re round. What was the murder weapon?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Hard to tell. A knitting needle, maybe. An ice pick. Your guess is as good as mine. Her attacker knew about anatomy. He pierced her carotid and her subclavian arteries. She bled out in minutes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means our killer might have had a medical background. You know, there are no signs of forced entry. Do we know how this killer came in?

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Well, we’re not really sure, but he definitely wanted Abby to know that he was here. She was texted this photo at 10:33, right around time of death.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The killer sent this?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Right before he murdered her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He was watching her. And then he sent that to terrorize her. This was personal. Well, so much for the warm embrace of technology.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is there any way to trace the text?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, we’ll try, but it was sent from a burner phone. Um, meanwhile we’ll check with the neighbors, see if they saw anything.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, and talk to friends and family. If this was personal they might have an idea as to who was behind this.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, why don’t we start with this guy. Carlos. She was on the phone with him right before she received the text message. Judging by their call history he looks to be the boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: CARLOS VILLEGAS
utterance.content: I can’t believe this happened. I should have been there to protect her.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We have to ask you, Carlos. Who else had a key to Abby’s place?

utterance.speaker: CARLOS
utterance.content: Nobody. Just the landlord.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You know if she was expecting any visitors?

utterance.speaker: CARLOS
utterance.content: No. She was actually heading out to, uh … Club Doom. She had booked a personal appearance there.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh … Abby was a celebrity?

utterance.speaker: CARLOS
utterance.content: She was huge on social media.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So was she an actress or a singer or what?

utterance.speaker: CARLOS
utterance.content: No, she posted pics on Snappamatic. You know, the photo sharing app? Snappamatic reviews, she called them.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And that got her personal appearances?

utterance.speaker: CARLOS
utterance.content: Yeah, and sponsors, too. Especially when she had half a million followers.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What did Abby review, exactly?

utterance.speaker: CARLOS
utterance.content: They were like, joke reviews. She came to New York to be a comedian, and um … … this is how she hit it big.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: “These gyros came right back up. That’s a two-for-one special you don’t want.”

utterance.speaker: CARLOS
utterance.content: This pic went viral and overnight she was a star. With follows and fans, all this attention, I felt like I was losing her. Like there was no room left for the two of us.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Do you think she had any stalkers?

utterance.speaker: CARLOS
utterance.content: If she did I’m not sure she would have told me.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did any of these reviewees get upset about the pictures she posted?

utterance.speaker: CARLOS
utterance.content: Actually, yeah. There was guy. He made threatening calls.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What was his name?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Edward Han. He’s an acupuncturist. His cell phone records show that he called Abby a dozen times in the days before her murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And who better than an acupuncturist to kill with accurate punctures? Perhaps with a giant needle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And he has the anatomical training to know where to strike.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not to mention a beef with Abby. Check this out. This was posted all over the place and I bet it put a damper on Han’s practice.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “Do not let this guy poke you.”

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t get it. Posting dumbass photos all over the place? How does she have a fan base? How did this become a career?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Welcome to the sharing economy.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: More like oversharing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? And you’re opposed to all photos of oversharing women?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s … different.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. Han’s starting to look good for this. One of Abby’s neighbors saw him at her apartment yesterday.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: At her apartment? Doing what?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Screaming at her. Threatening to “make her pay”. Until she slammed the door in his face.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So maybe he went back to get the last word.

utterance.speaker: EDWARD HAN
utterance.content: I never went back. I admit I was at her apartment and I may have said those things, but –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You were angry about this review.

utterance.speaker: HAN
utterance.content: Review? That bimbo was never even a client. She posted that picture and my walk-ins dropped off. Her little joke was costing me my business!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah well, in our business we call that motive. Where were you last night at 10:30?

utterance.speaker: HAN
utterance.content: Off drowning my sorrows. I swear to you, I did not do this. But I know who did. She had a stalker.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, I know. We’re looking at him.

utterance.speaker: HAN
utterance.content: Not me! That’s what Abby thought, too, that I was stalking her.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And why would she think that? Maybe because you were calling her all the time, showing up at her place?

utterance.speaker: HAN
utterance.content: Abby said someone had been following her for the last month. But I didn’t track her down until a week ago. So the stalker couldn’t have been me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Han, do you have evidence that this other person actually exists?

utterance.speaker: HAN
utterance.content: There’s a note. On a postcard.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What note?

utterance.speaker: HAN
utterance.content: A threat she got that day. She waved it in my face. She accused me of slipping it under her door. Whoever left that note, that’s who did this. It has to be.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Han’s alibi checks out. Bartender said he was well into this fourth Mai Tai at the time of the murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: On reflection, it’s just as well. From a storytelling standpoint. I mean, “Do not let this guy poke you” - and then the acupuncturist stabs her with a giant needle? It’s just a little too obvious.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means we’re looking for someone else with motive, but so far no one sticks out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe Abby’s family has some insight.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They don’t. She wasn’t very close to them.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It looks like Han was telling the truth about that threat. CSU found this postcard in Abby’s dresser drawer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: “The brightest stars burn quickest.”

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She got this and on the same day she was murdered?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is this a fingerprint?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, that’s a smudge. But it might mean something. The lab says that it’s wood varnish.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey guys. Check this out.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I was looking through Abby’s followers and one of them posted pictures of her on their account.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Crime scene photos?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But not ours. The killer took these photos before we got to the crime scene.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “This star’s 15 seconds are over.”

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Whose account is this?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: User name is … Netslayer.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He kills her and then posts her picture. Why would he do that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tear down the victim? Add insult to injury? “This star’s 15 seconds are over.” Maybe that’s why he killed Abby, because she’s a web celebrity.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Or he wants to become one himself.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Abby did have half a million followers. Killing her would give him an instant high profile.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or he could just be using social media to hide his true motives for killing her. Either way, maybe these photos can help us find him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, I’ll get with Tory. We’ll analyze the photos, see if we can pull some images off the reflections.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right. And I’ll go through his account, see if he posted anything else that would help us ID him. Where are you guys going?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Straight to the source. Maybe Snappamatic can give us an idea of who he is or where to find him.

utterance.speaker: KENT WILDER
utterance.content: Actually, ID’ing and locating users are two things we just can’t do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can’t? Or won’t?

utterance.speaker: OREN WILDER
utterance.content: Can’t. Snappamatic was designed for privacy. It runs on a software platform that anonymizes all of our users.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I bet that was a real selling point for the killer.

utterance.speaker: OREN
utterance.content: Look, no one is more upset about this than we are.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I bet Abby Smith was. One of your users killed her and you’re trying to tell me that you can’t help us.

utterance.speaker: KENT
utterance.content: We’re trying. Evan’s combing the guy’s account but all you need to register is a valid email address.

utterance.speaker: EVAN
utterance.content: Which isn’t valid anymore, by the way, so no help there.

utterance.speaker: OREN
utterance.content: What we can do is suspend his account so he can’t post.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, well the reason he’s posting in the first place is because he wants attention. He needs to communicate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Exactly. He likes to share, so let him. Maybe he’s going to share something that he didn’t intend to. Now, take the pictures down but leave the account up.

utterance.speaker: OREN
utterance.content: We’d rather not have the Snappamatic brand associated with a murderer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It already is. It’s our pipeline directly to the killer. The account stays open.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Consider the bright side, gentlemen. The traffic for your site will be through the roof.

utterance.speaker: EVAN
utterance.content: I think I got something. I was digging through the metadata and found a geotag anomaly on one of the pictures.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What kind of an anomaly?

utterance.speaker: EVAN
utterance.content: Okay, so the geotag holds GPS coordinates, usually of where a photo was taken.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Usually, but not always?

utterance.speaker: EVAN
utterance.content: Not if the camera loses its GPS signal. In that case, the geotag is assigned when the photo is uploaded.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So the killer lost his GPS signal, didn’t notice –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then when he posted his photos onto Snappamatic he accidently revealed his location. What are the coordinates?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Tory plotted the longitude and latitude of the geotag and we got an address in downtown Manhattan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what’s there?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s a vintage furniture store.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wood – wood varnish! That explains the smudge on the note!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, let’s get the names of everyone that works there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We already did. It’s a one man shop owned by one Bill Garrett. It turns out he used to be a cop until he had a nervous breakdown. And get this – he worked in the cyber division.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which means he would know his way around the web and social media.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Bring him in.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Bill Garrett! NYPD! Keep your hands where we can see them.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: On your knees. You know the drill.

utterance.speaker: BILL GARRETT
utterance.content: Getting brought in here is no way to treat a fellow officer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Garrett, we found these when we searched your shop.

utterance.speaker: GARRETT
utterance.content: I refinish furniture. Of course I have awls.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Awls that match the stab wounds in her neck?

utterance.speaker: GARRETT
utterance.content: If you think I murdered this girl you’re out of your mind.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We also found this cell phone.

utterance.speaker: GARRETT
utterance.content: I keep it for emergencies.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Emergencies. Like uh … snapping photos?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You see, even when you delete them they can still be recovered.

utterance.speaker: GARRETT
utterance.content: All right, what is this? I didn’t take those.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then how did they end up on your phone? And why were they uploaded to Snappamatic using your wifi network?

utterance.speaker: GARRETT
utterance.content: I don’t upload photos. I don’t even go near the web unless I have to.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then there’s the text to Abby, and the wood varnish on this note, which we’re going to trace right back to your shop. It’s over. Your best bet is to cut a deal.

utterance.speaker: GARRETT
utterance.content: This is a mistake.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Working cyber unit must’ve taken its toll. It must have been difficult, seeing the darkest side of the web. That must have changed you. Maybe that’s why you left and did what you did.

utterance.speaker: GARRETT
utterance.content: I didn’t do anything. And I quit cyber because a frat boy date raped a girl, posted the photos online, and then got away with it, so I flipped out and I put him in the hospital. I did not hurt this girl. I do not know her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you at 10:30PM?

utterance.speaker: GARRETT
utterance.content: I was at home.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: With who?

utterance.speaker: GARRETT
utterance.content: Nobody. I was alone.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This was just posted to the Netslayer’s account.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s you guys arresting Garrett.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wait, what’s this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: “Wrong suspect, NYPD. I’m still here. What will I do next?”

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So either Garrett was framed –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Or somehow he pulled this off to make it look like he was framed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Whoever this is, he just took this to a whole new level. He’s taunting us.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: More pictures are coming in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Body parts?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Body parts, sausages, a date? What the hell is this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “The game is on.” That’s a challenge. Those are clues.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Clues to what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: His next murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Body parts … sausage … November 12th. Body parts being made into sausage. Human sausages … in November. I’m not getting anywhere with this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you’re sure? Okay. Thanks. Garrett’s alibi checks out. He activated his alarm system when he got home last night and no one entered or exited until morning.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So the killer set him up just to toy with us.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN VICTORIA GATES
utterance.content: Detective? The news media’s calling for comment. 1PP wants to know what we think this is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re not sure. This could be a clue as to his next victim or victims. Each image could represent a different person.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or it could be a pictogram where the images add up to a message.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Tory’s trying to analyze each image, find their sources. But we think this collage is from one photo of a woman, Caucasian, in her 20s.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: So she could be our next target.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And given the killer’s behavior, she’s most likely someone with a high internet profile like Abby Smith.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. So we ID’d that grill as a Fowler. We’re checking into anybody named Fowler who might be big on social media.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: And that date. November 12th. Any special significance?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, for starters, it turns out it is World Pneumonia Day. But we’re also checking into any news events, births, and deaths that occurred that day.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If it even is a date. 11-12-13 could be part of a number sequence.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yes, Castle. We’re also looking into that, as well as anyone Garrett put away while he was in cyber.

utterance.speaker: TORY ELLIS
utterance.content: Detective Beckett?

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: I was able to identify one of the images.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: It was cropped from this photo of a food blogger named Mary Fuchs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where did you find that photo?

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: She posted it on her Snappamatic feed a few days ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So Mary Fuchs is a Snappamatic user just like Abby Smith.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She could be next. We need to find her and bring her in here.

utterance.speaker: MARY FUCHS
utterance.content: I don’t understand. Why would someone post part of my picture?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ms. Fuchs, do these images mean anything to you? Or this date?

utterance.speaker: MARY
utterance.content: No. I mean, I don’t think so.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about Abby Smith? Do you know her? Do you have any connection to her?

utterance.speaker: MARY
utterance.content: I’d never even heard of her until it was all over the news that she died. Is whoever killed her after me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, has anyone been following you? Have you received any threatening messages?

utterance.speaker: MARY
utterance.content: No, nothing like that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re a blogger, right? What do you blog about?

utterance.speaker: MARY
utterance.content: Uh, German cuisine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: German cuisine?

utterance.speaker: MARY
utterance.content: I’m German, so I review German restaurants. And I post recipes for classic dishes like strudel and the bratwurst I’m grilling in the picture.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So your Snappamatic page says that you have – – 47 followers.

utterance.speaker: MARY
utterance.content: Yeah. I think that’s pretty good, considering I just joined last week.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t get it. Killing put the Netslayer onto the big stage. Taunting the police about it just turned on the Klieg lights. Why target a no-name like her?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe he’s trying to send a message that no one’s safe. Not web-celebs or obscure German food bloggers.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, you better add artists to that list as well. Tory just ID’d another one of our images.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is it from Snappamatic?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. From the feed of a painter named Daniel Leek. The image is from a photo he took of one of his pieces. See, the expiration date is cropped from the top of this milk carton. But Leek’s pretty low on the Snappamatic totem pole. He only has about two thousand followers. Heck, my blog has more than that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You have a blog?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah. The Ryan Report. It’s the musings of a homicide detective? You haven’t read it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No – I – oh, The Ryan Report. Yeah. I thought – because I didn’t –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, in spite of Leek’s following, let’s try to get him in.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well … that’s going to be difficult. He’s at an art opening in Seattle. He doesn’t live in New York.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If he lives in Seattle how is he a possible victim?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s not. Rotten fruit, expiration date … What’s the name of that painting?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh … “Spoiled”, I think.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know what the clues mean.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Expiration date on spoiled milk. Plus grilled bratwurst equals … spoiled brats. That’s the message. That’s what the images mean, leading us to … Seriously? Anyone here besides me a consumer of vapid online magazines?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, all right. Spoiled brats, as in – – “The Spoiled Brats of Snappamatic” feature article from two weeks ago. It’s all about rich kids who post pictures of their extravagant lifestyles on Snappamatic.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s the key to solving the case. The killer has given us a pictogram – as I predicted – pointing us to that article.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, maybe, but what about the third image? The collage?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This is it! This is the photo. Those are Tatiana Fisher’s body parts from this photo that she took with her boyfriend Cam Magani. He posted it on his Snappamatic feed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Spoiled … brat … Tatiana.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: She has over a million followers.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Going after her would raise the killer’s infamy to new heights. She’s the next victim.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Tatiana Fisher, NYPD. We’ve been trying to get a hold of you and Cam Magani. We have reason to believe that you might be the Netslayer’s next target.

utterance.speaker: TATIANA FISHER
utterance.content: That’s insane. He wouldn’t dare.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, maybe not. But we need to take you back to the precinct.

utterance.speaker: TATIANA
utterance.content: I’m not going anywhere with you. I have a party on Fire Island, so…

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ma’am, this is a potentially dangerous situation.

utterance.speaker: TATIANA
utterance.content: Did you just call me ma’am? Look, I’ll make it simple for you, okay? Can you force me to go with you? Yes or no.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: TATIANA
utterance.content: Well then. Bye bye.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, Ms. Fisher – Ms. Fisher.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Please. Just give us a –

utterance.speaker: TATIANA
utterance.content: Oh my God, Cam!

utterance.speaker: NEWS REPORTER WOMAN
utterance.content: The internet is abuzz today with news of a serial killer stalking social media.

utterance.speaker: NEWS REPORTER MAN
utterance.content: The representatives of Snappamatic, the online photo sharing app, have released a statement saying that they are cooperating with authorities.

utterance.speaker: NEWS REPORTER WOMAN
utterance.content: Socialite Cam Magani’s body was found murdered in the vehicle you see behind me. Magani may be the latest victim of Netslayer, the mysterious online figure who claimed responsibility of Abby Smith, then posted gruesome images of body. With the city and internet roiling with fear, many are asking, who will this serial killer strike next and when will authorities stop him?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: This guy is getting exactly what he wanted: attention. And it’s making him bolder, so where do we stand?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, it looks like the killer hid in the back seat of Cam’s car, waited for him to get in, and then slit his throat.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: How did he get in the car?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, we’re not sure, but CSU found plastic fragments inside the door lock. It might be from a lock pick.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So far there’s no prints or DNA and all we know for sure is that the killer was right handed.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: And we paid too high a cost for that knowledge. Detective? Bring me some good news before we lose another one.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes sir.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can’t help but think if only I had figured it out sooner maybe he’s still be alive.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It wouldn’t have mattered. The game was rigged from the start. We never had a chance. The killer just wanted us to think we did. And now the Netslayer’s going to gain more notoriety and more followers.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He already has. He’s at over half a million so far and earning thousands more by the minute.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: Detective Beckett. Two more pictures just came in. Something different this time.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: This one was uploaded first. Proof of death, I guess you’d call it. Then he sent this one.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, it’s us before the first crime scene.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “NYPD is on the case. Feel safe New York? You shouldn’t. I’m not done.”

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s been watching us from the beginning. The guy’s been ahead of us the whole time.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Detective Beckett? A word.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: 1PP saw that picture, too. And they called me, concerned, about your commitment to this case.

utterance.speaker: BECKTT
utterance.content: Sir, they’re taking that photo out of context.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: The truth doesn’t matter, Kate. It’s a public relations problem now. The killer just turned you into the poster child for these murders not being solved.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So … what? They want to take me off the case?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I told them no. I won’t let our suspect sabotage this investigation by manipulating the narrative. So go home, clear your head. You get back here and you take his ass down.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This is why I hate social media. Once something is out there you have no control. People can take a private moment and create their own context. I mean, we weren’t even investigating the murder yet and they made us look like we were bad cops. Or worse. Like we didn’t care.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Come on, Beckett, it’s the internet. No one’s going to take that picture seriously.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: 1PP did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look. It’s going to blow over, okay? With millions of items being posted every minute this is but a blip on the net continuum.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know the problem with anonymity? There’s no accountability. It empowers cowards to become bullies, just like this guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know what? Most bullies started out as victims themselves. Maybe this guy is lashing out on the internet because it was used against him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He was a victim of a cybercrime.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And Bill Garrett was a cyber-cop. It can’t be a coincidence that the killer targeted him. We’ve been looking at people Garrett put away –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When we should have been looking at victims of his cyber cases. Okay, I’ll get ahold of Garrett, I’ll have him look into his old case files. Our killer’s got to be in there somewhere.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Still, how did he get into Garrett’s shop to plant the evidence? Or Cam’s car?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’ll tell you how. With a key. A key that he made.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A 3D printer.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Remember the fragment that we found in the lock of Cam’s Rolls Royce? Well, they’re PLA. It’s a bio plastic used in 3D printing. CSU found PLA in the locks at Abby’s apartment as well as Garrett’s shop.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How could the killer make a copy of the key without the original?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It turns out all you need is a picture. When Cam bought the Rolls, he bragged about it by posting a photo of the key that anyone could then digitize. So, just as the killer did, I uploaded a photo to the printer and – – voila.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Outstanding.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If by outstanding you mean horrifying. The killer snapped a photo of this key and then made a 3D duplicate of it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Welcome to the future.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Still, I’ve gotta get one of these.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is there any way of finding out where the killer got his?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, we’re checking. But between brick and mortar and online stores we’ve got hundreds of vendors.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, this explains how he got Cam’s key but not Garrett and Abby’s.

utterance.speaker: CARLOS
utterance.content: Abby never posted photos of her keys. And she was careful. It’s not like she left them lying around.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Did she ever valet park her car?

utterance.speaker: CARLOS
utterance.content: No. She didn’t even drive it, except to get out of the city.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Any of her friends have keys to her place?

utterance.speaker: CARLOS
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She never let anybody crash there?

utterance.speaker: CARLOS
utterance.content: Actually … Abby used to rent out her apartment online. Through a travel site.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The people who stayed, how’d they get her keys?

utterance.speaker: CARLOS
utterance.content: She’d leave them under a loose brick on her stoop.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So I’ve been running the people that rented Abby’s apartment.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why would anyone let complete strangers stay in their place?

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: Extra money. After this I don’t think I’ll be doing it anymore.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So all the renters checked out except for one guy who booked and never showed up.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: This is from an ATM across from Abby’s apartment on the day he was supposed to stay there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Turns out a guy did show up. Check this out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He took a picture of her key. It’s the Netslayer. It’s gotta be.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: It’s too far away and too low res to blow up, but watch this as he walks away.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: There.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And now we have a face.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Okay, where are we on finding this man?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’re distributing his picture. So far none of the victim’s families or neighbors recognize him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, I’d like to release his photo to the press and social media. Let’s turn the tables on this guy. He’s trying to hide, but someone out there’s going to recognize his face.

utterance.speaker: GARRETT
utterance.content: You’re right. And that someone is me. I was going over these case files when the officer showed me his photo.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who is he?

utterance.speaker: GARRETT
utterance.content: His name’s Adam Lane.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: You arrested him?

utterance.speaker: GARRETT
utterance.content: He wasn’t a criminal when we met. He was a victim.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And do you have any idea where he is now?

utterance.speaker: GARRETT
utterance.content: I haven’t seen or heard from Lane in six years. It took me a minute to recognize him with that fake beard he’s wearing.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Okay. I’ll get ready to release Adam Lane’s name and picture to the media.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: There’s no current address for Lane.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Try to find one. Reach out to his family and anyone else that knows him. In the meantime you need to tell us everything you know about Adam Lane.

utterance.speaker: GARRETT
utterance.content: Lane was in high school back then. It was a cyber-bullying case.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who was bullying him?

utterance.speaker: GARRETT
utterance.content: He was taking a shower when this meathead football player, Tim Witherspoon, stole his clothes. Now, this had happened to Lane his whole life, but this time he went ballistic. There he was, buck naked, screaming at Witherspoon in the locker room.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think I know where the cyber part comes in.

utterance.speaker: GARRETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Witherspoon secretly recorded it and posted it on his MySpace page.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So he was publicly humiliated.

utterance.speaker: GARRETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but it wasn’t just the humiliation. After the video, the kids turned on him. They inundated him with these awful, hateful emails. And no one was held accountable.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: GARRETT
utterance.content: The cyber-bullying laws at the time were weak. I got him to take the video down but I couldn’t convince the DA to press charges. I should have tried harder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What happened to Lane?

utterance.speaker: GARRETT
utterance.content: Everyone had their breaking point, right? Quit school, withdrew from life. It ruined him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And now he’s getting revenge by going after the popular kids on social media.

utterance.speaker: GARRETT
utterance.content: And targeting me because I didn’t protect him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not just you. All of us. Did he have any friends? Was there anywhere he liked to hang out?

utterance.speaker: GARRETT
utterance.content: No, he was a loner. Computer geek. He didn’t have any friends. That’s pretty much all I know.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. I’m having no luck tracking down Adam Lane. It looks like he went off the grid. No tax returns, no driver’s license, no job except for a stint at a funeral home three years ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That must be how he knows about anatomy. What about his parents?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, father wasn’t in the picture, mother died about a year ago.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, get this. I ran down Tim Witherspoon, Lane’s bully. Turns out, he’s dead. Unsolved homicide. He was stabbed in his apartment ten months ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s right after Lane’s mother died. Maybe that’s what triggered him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So he murdered Witherspoon, took his revenge, but that wasn’t enough for him. Where did Lane and his mom live?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, the apartment sold when she died, but they lived on Avenue C at East 5th.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s the Lower East Side. Ever since we released Lane’s photo we’ve had multiple tips that he’d been seen in that area.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: An antisocial kid like Lane who’s never made his way in the world is going to stay with what’s familiar. The Lower East Side’s the only neighborhood he’s ever known.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who bought his mother’s place?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: An old Russian couple. But the basement is a rental unit.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who wants to bet Lane’s still living there?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Adam Lane, you’re under arrest for murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s so funny.

utterance.speaker: ADAM LANE
utterance.content: You’ll see.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We got a problem.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s the problem? We’ve got Adam Lane in custody.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, he’s got people in custody, too. It just showed up on the Netslayer feed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What people?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oren and Kent Wilder from Snappamatic.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: They’re about to be his next victims.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “Like me or I die”. It’s a popularity contest.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And Kent is losing. These guys' photos update every five seconds along with their votes.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: They’re both attached to electrical leads.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: They probably lead to a power supply controlled by a computer.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That countdown started at one hour. Once it reaches zero …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whichever brother has the least votes gets his heart stopped.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or they both do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It's the ultimate attack on social media.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And us. He wants us to feel powerless. Those guys are going to die even though he’s in custody.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not if we get to them first.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: In 37 minutes? How are we going to do that? They’re in front of tarps. There’s no background detail. These guys could be anywhere. Maybe even in separate places.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Go to the Snappamatic offices. Maybe they’ll help us track down the source of these photos now that Kent and Oren’s lives are at stake.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What are you going to do?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m going to make Adam Lane talk.

utterance.speaker: ADAM
utterance.content: So who’s ahead? Oren or Kent?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Time isn’t just running out for them, Adam. It’s running out for you as well. Your one and only window of opportunity is about to close.

utterance.speaker: ADAM
utterance.content: I have nothing to say.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, I’m not going to lie to you. You are going to prison. But if you tell me where Kent and Oren are then you can still control what kind of prison.

utterance.speaker: ADAM
utterance.content: What’s the expression? Three hots and a cot? Works for me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, you’re not going to be saying that if you get sent to the super max unit, where we put our most dangerous and violent inmates. You’ll be on lockdown there 24/7 for the rest of your life.

utterance.speaker: ADAM
utterance.content: It can’t be any worse than high school.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? And you think that you were bullied? Well prison is going to take you places that you can’t imagine. A guy like you? Young, teachable?

utterance.speaker: ADAM
utterance.content: It doesn’t matter. I already have what I want.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what do you think you have?

utterance.speaker: ADAM
utterance.content: A legacy. The internet is permanent. The Netslayer will live forever. I’ll be mentioned in the same breath as Manson and the Zodiac and … if I commit a murder while in police custody, while looking you in the eye, I could argue I did them one better. And there’s nothing you can do to stop me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Adam, you need help. You’re sick. Let me get you –

utterance.speaker: ADAM
utterance.content: I’m sick? Nobody had to follow me. No one has to vote for Kent or Oren. But they can’t help themselves. They want to be a part of it. They have to watch. So … who is really sick?

utterance.speaker: GARRETT
utterance.content: He wasn’t always like that. If I could go back and do it over again …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You didn’t make him this way.

utterance.speaker: GARRETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but I didn’t stop it. And now I can’t stop these two guys from dying.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If anyone can break him, it’s Detective Beckett. And there’s still a chance Snappamatic can help us.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How’re we doing?

utterance.speaker: EVAN
utterance.content: Coding’s not like flipping a switch. It takes a little while.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We don’t have a little while, Evan. We have – – fifteen minutes to find these guys.

utterance.speaker: EVAN
utterance.content: I’m going as fast as I can. Kent was working on a software patch that would disable the program’s privacy protocols.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And if we disable the protocols we can track where these photos are coming from?

utterance.speaker: EVAN
utterance.content: Yes. I mean, in theory. The thing is, we’ve never done it before. I don’t know if it’ll work.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Our canvass didn’t turn up a single witness to the abduction. We’re nowhere, bro. Tell me you’ve got something.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: About to find out.

utterance.speaker: EVAN
utterance.content: Okay. Let’s do this.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: EVAN
utterance.content: The system crashed. We’re locked out.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, get it back up! We’ve got fifteen minutes before these guys are dead.

utterance.speaker: EVAN
utterance.content: It takes twenty minutes to reboot.

utterance.speaker: GARRETT
utterance.content: What just happened?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whatever they were trying didn’t go well. The site just crashed.

utterance.speaker: GARRETT
utterance.content: So there’s no way to trace those feeds of Oren and Kent? And that timer will just keep counting down until one of them is dead?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s all up to Beckett now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Adam, just answer one question and it might save your life. Where are Oren and Kent?

utterance.speaker: ADAM
utterance.content: If you cops were capable of doing your jobs you’d know. And looking back, maybe none of this would have ever happened.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, a horrible thing was done to you. But how is killing two more people going to fix that? How is that going to heal you? It won’t.

utterance.speaker: ADAM
utterance.content: It will. Don’t you see that I’ve already won? I’ll tell you what: admit that I won and I’ll give you a hint. I’ll give you a change to find Kent or Oren before ­–

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fine. You won. Now give me the hint.

utterance.speaker: ADAM
utterance.content: Changed my mind.

utterance.speaker: GARRETT
utterance.content: Seven minutes left. She’d gotta make a move, shake him up somehow.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She will.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Netslayer. That’s evocative. I could – I could see how you would pick that. I picture a hooded figure, in all black, tall, muscular, maybe carrying an axe. But you know what I don’t picture, Adam? What nobody pictures? You. You think that you won? You haven’t. Everyone else has.

utterance.speaker: ADAM
utterance.content: What do you mean, everyone else?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Everyone who ever bullied you, whoever hurt you. Belittled you. Who thought that you were weak and worthless and small. And you know what, Adam? They were right.

utterance.speaker: ADAM
utterance.content: No, they weren’t. I am not any of those things.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re all of them. And worse.

utterance.speaker: ADAM
utterance.content: I am what people made me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You were born this way, or your mommy made you, but Tim Witherspoon and the rest of the kids at school? They didn’t break you. You were already broken. They only sensed what you were and what you were about to become. So you know what? In a way their bullying wasn’t enough.

utterance.speaker: ADAM
utterance.content: How can you say that to me? I’m the victim here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you’re always going to be the victim. You think that hiding behind a user name and killing is going to change that? That won’t get you respect. You’re always going to be the same pathetic loser that you always were.

utterance.speaker: ADAM
utterance.content: I am not a loser!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And when you abducted Kent and Oren, I bet the two of them looked at each other and thought, “Are we being punked here?”

utterance.speaker: ADAM
utterance.content: Believe me, they didn’t.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They think it’s a joke.

utterance.speaker: ADAM
utterance.content: They’re afraid. They’re - they’re terrified.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They’re sharing a laugh right now about you.

utterance.speaker: ADAM
utterance.content: They are not laughing!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She just got them to say that they’re together.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, they’re laughing. They’re laughing right now.

utterance.speaker: ADAM
utterance.content: Well, not for long. That clock will hit zero and their screams will echo off the tiled walls as they take in their last breath of stale air and then? They’ll both fry.

utterance.speaker: GARRETT
utterance.content: Tiled walls and stale air? That was how he talked about the locker room at his school.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where Witherspoon put him on the video. He’s bringing this thing full circle. What was the name of that high school?

utterance.speaker: GARRETT
utterance.content: Harding High, but they moved to a new campus. The original building is shut down.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Javi, the wires!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: GARRETT
utterance.content: I just wanted to say thanks for letting me pitch in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you kidding me? We couldn’t have done this without you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, Oren and Kent are alive because of your help.

utterance.speaker: GARRETT
utterance.content: Well, it’s always good to get a win. Well, see you around.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: See you around.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: See you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, there used to be some finality to all of this. You take a photo, dump it in the box, and you never see that face again. Not anymore.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, Adam Lane is going to be on the news every night. He’ll be on the web for weeks. Months. Geez, years. Ironic that by catching him we’re giving him exactly what he wanted. More followers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, after this case I think I’m ready to unplug. Stay off the internet for a while.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, but before you do, we have one last piece of internet business.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Come in, you guys. Come in. Right this way. Right this way! After you.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Okay. Ah ha!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right. My publisher just sent me the link for the web-mercial for Raging Heat. Prepare for greatness in three … two … one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hi. I’m Richard – I’ve got gum. I’m going to put my gum out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hi, I’m Richard Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hi, I’m Crichard Rastle. Hi, I’m Richard Castle. Hi, I’m Richard Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hi, I’m Crichard Rastle. I’m Richard Castle. For a spine-tingling, bone-chilling adventure, Raging Heat. For a spine-tingling, bone-chilling adventure, Raging Heat. For a spine-tingling, bone-chilling adventure, Raging Heat. For a sp – . It’s not an adventure. It’s a thriller. Why don’t you download your copy today? Hi, I’m Richard Castle. Hi, I’m Crichard Rastle. I’m Richard Castle. Hi, I’m Richard Castle. Hi, I’m Crichard Rastle. I’m Richard Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What the hell was that?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, you’ve gotten over a million hits.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A million people have seen that?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: It’s gone viral, darling. Isn’t that what you wanted?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not like this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t worry, Castle. It’ll blow over. This is but a blip on the net continuum. But … we so need to watch this one again.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
